issue.title: Update EF Core

repository.name: EntityFrameworkCore.Jet
repository.description: Entity Framework Core provider for Access database

issue.body:
Updates EF Core to 8.0.3

There is still some tests failing due to a change in the base test e.g. Can_apply_all_migrations

The base test now includes a string with new lines as part of the sql statement. It is part of a string literal direct from C# so there is not processing on it before hand. The test value is a property as part of a private class within the base class so can't just override it

```
INSERT INTO Table1 (Id, Bar, Description) VALUES (-1, ' ', 'Value With

Empty Lines')
```

@lauxjpn Thoughts?

issue.title: Stop stripping new lines from migration script literals

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #32730

Will port to 8.0 for patch after merge.

issue.title: Correct value type in hard-coded migrations test

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Column is created as int, but then used as string. Causing issues for Pomelo MySQL provider.

Fixes #33331

body: Is this going to be backported to 8.0?
@ChrisJollyAU this is a test-only fix, why would it need backporting?

maybe backporting wasn't the right word. But is this test-only fix going to be added to the 8.0 series? Both myself and @lauxjpn picked this up when updating from 8.0.2 to 8.0.3. #33404 looks like its only merged into main (9.0 series). The relevant tests will still fail in 8.0

We pretty rarely cherry-pick/backport test fixes to released branches - only when there's a good reason; for example, when backporting/cherry-picking an actual bugfix, we also take the tests verifying that fix along. But in this case, this seems like a test-only fix (no actual bug) - given that you'll see everything working well in your main branch, it seems like keeping the tests skipped on 8.0 is OK, no?
